item.title: Sr. Consultant, Enterprise Data Analytics
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

Governance Lead, Data and Analytics Strategy Enablement is a key member of the Enterprise Data & Analytics Enablement team. Our mandate is to employ tailored approach to support each Line of Business strategy and transform and accelerate the BI/Analytics (BIA) experience within CIBC. We are here to enable our business partners to seamlessly adopt data analytics tools and capabilities and make data-driven decisions in an efficient and secured manner.

Reporting to the Senior Director, Data and Analytics Enablement, this role is a key role to drive the One Enablement team vision and the successful incumbent will be responsible for establishing an effective governance of the data and self-serve BI/ analytical tool enablement, building out an effective support framework to accelerate data driven insights, including processes and best practice documentation. The role is also to provide leadership and establish effective collaboration with key enablement teams across organization to accelerate user access journey, and advance data and analytics maturity for our stakeholders no matter where they are in their analytics journey. 

Success will be attained through  partnering with various data intensive projects & initiatives as well as key business stakeholders. Data Strategy Enablement and Governance Consultant will share subject matter expertise in CIBC processes, methodologies, data flows, system integrations, application dependencies, and Information Security and Data Governance and Management requirements. 

How You’ll Succeed

Support Data Enablement Strategy- support the roll-out of enterprise-wide data enablement strategy including mobilization of One data enablement team in a hub and spoke model- conduct gap assessment of the current state, provide requirements and lead the work packages related to:

  • Acceleration of data access journey for enterprise users- mobilize stakeholders, define, document, and drive the rollout of process definition and operationalization of processes;

  • Definition and management of enterprise governance oversight framework self-serve BI analytics tools, data enablement and advisory function;

  • Business and process requirements and managing deliverables against business partner expectations and time sensitive deadlines.

Support Data and Analytics Enablement Governance Framework- establish and support foundational platform (tools, data/ metadata, access) governance and management requirements enabling consistent data consumption across enterprise data enablement platform in a Cloud environment, including:

  • Develop, implement and manage processes and standards for team engagement; ensure clarity around processes;

  • Identify key capabilities and development needs and provide requirements for enterprise-wide best practices, including KRIs and help to create requirements documentation;

  • Collaborate with other stakeholders and supporting teams to ensure clarity around policies, standards, and that there is process consistency and alignment with Enterprise standards.

Provide Oversight Function- facilitate and support internal and external reviews by:

  • Supporting all internal and external audit and oversight reviews, and manage deliverables as a result of review findings;

  • Playing a critical role in driving  increase efficiency, including process optimization and automation where practical; and establishing meaningful KPI tracking

  • Ensuring that a review and approval in Data and Analytics Impact assessment resulting from PFR and CIRA notifications.

Leadership- provide leadership in designing data enablement rollout strategy by liaising with various lines of businesses, analytical groups, user base, technology, change management. Lead and partner with cross functional groups fostering BI/ Analytics research and innovation culture.

  • Focus on Innovation and Simplification - Strive for continual enhancement of data quality and contribute to system and governance process simplification

  • Relationship Management- focus on building strong relationships with internal and external clients. Work collaboratively with teams across the bank to understand their data and analytical needs. Work with the teams to identify their data and analytical neds and provide appropriate support and recommendations.

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate experience in working in an internal consulting team with a focus on enterprise enablement- data management, process engineering, business intelligence and managing large scale, complex projects and teams in the financial services industry. Exposure to data consumption is an asset with a focus on data requirements for enterprise wide inititives.

  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems and making sense of information. Understanding internal banking processes and how they translate into data outputs.

  • You\'re driven to succeed. You are motivated by accomplishing your goals and delivering your best to make an impact.

  • You act like an owner. You thrive when you\'re empowered to take the lead, go above and beyond, and deliver results.

  • You embrace and champion change. You\'ll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.

  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability. You strive to lead with integrity; continuous improvement and talent development are an integral part of your personal brand. You bring people and networks together to Get Stuff Done.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home

  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity

  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning and comprehensive product training

  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work in Canada at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

  • This is a regular full time role with a schedule of 37.5 hours each week.

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Job Location

Toronto-55 Yonge Street, 6th

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

item.title: Consultant, Enterprise Data Analytics
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing :

Our mandate is to employ tailored approach to support each Line of Business strategy and transform and accelerate the BI/Analytics (BIA) experience within CIBC. We are here to enable our business to make data-driven decisions in an efficient and secured manner, part of that mandate is to assist teams in acquiring the data required for their business decisions. This roles focus is on third party data, governance and vendor management. You’ll be working with vendors and different line of businesses within CIBC on credit bureau related issues. You’ll collaborate with a diverse team to create and build flexible innovative solutions and will be acting as a subject matter expert on Credit Bureau. Your role will be critical in connecting our technology and business teams, and vendors to ensure their functionalities are aligned.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Relationship Manager- Confident working with senior management, and ability to manage relationships across the organization with proven ability to build strong working partnerships focused on outcomes. A strong and comprehensive knowledge of financial services is an asset.  

  • Communications Expert - Lead the development and execution of strategic communications plans and initiatives. Strong story teller through various mediums and deep experience with power point.  Provide communications advice and counsel internal stakeholders using effective communication principles, plans and processes.

  • Project Coordinator – Strong organization and project coordination skills with the ability to develop, manage and execute communication plans from end-to-end, while collaborating across teams.

  • Problem Solver – Work closely with the vendors and a diverse team across the bank to assist in solution design and discussions as needed. Build strong relationships, lead discussions, listen, and ask questions to assess governance related issues and to assist in solution. 

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate experience in understanding credit bureau concepts and understanding the bigger picture with the ability to tie concepts together.

  • You embrace and champion change. You\'ll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.

  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard

  • You look beyond the moment. You make decisions and take actions that will make a difference today and tomorrow. You proactively seek new opportunities to define what\'s possible.

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability..

  • You have a degree/diploma in Business, and/or a related field. It’s an asset if you have Credit Bureau related experience.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home

  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity

  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training

  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan.

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

item.title: Sr. Consultant, Enterprise Data Analytics
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

How You’ll Succeed

  • Subject Matter Expertise – Be the expert on SAS Grid from an governance, administration  and user enablement perspective, with the ability to support a wide spectrum of business users from the ones that are just starting on their analytical journey to the ones that have very specific and complex data engineering/modeling requirements.

  • Understanding and Documenting Requirements - Work closely with business partners to gather complex business requirements and facilitate requirements and solution discussions to ensure appropriate access to tools and data with alignment with the enterprise data governance processes. Build strong relationships, lead discussions, listen and ask the right questions to ensure requirements are documented and obtain stakeholders approvals.

  • Leadership - Provide leadership in designing data enablement rollout strategy by liaising with various lines of businesses, analytical groups, user base, technology, change management. Lead and partner with cross functional groups fostering BI/Analytics research & innovation culture.

  • Relationship Management -  Focus on building strong relationships with internal and external clients. Work collaboratively with teams across the bank to understand their data and analytical needs. Work with the teams to identify their data and analytical needs and provide appropriate support and recommendations Work with the platform vendors, technology teams and users to develop a community of practice around SAS.

  • Data Consultant - Provide expertise to enable various business teams to look at their business requirements through a data and analytics lens. Understand how various data sources and analytical platforms integrate with each other and be able to communicate these to both technical and business audience

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate experience in working in an internal consulting team with a focus on enterprise enablement. Exposure to data consumption is an asset with a focus on data requirements for enterprise wide initiatives.

  • You act like an owner. You thrive when you\'re empowered to take the lead, go above and beyond, and deliver results.

  • You embrace and champion change. You\'ll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.

  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.

  • You can demonstrate experience in: Agile Project Management, Financial Industry and/or Wealth knowledge. Working knowledge of: SAS and other analytical tools such as Tableau , Alteryx. Understanding of multi-tenant environment setup both from a technology infrastructure as well as access and governance perspective.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home

  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity 

  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning and comprehensive product training 

  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

**Prior to starting in this role, security checks, including a criminal record check must be successfully completed to the satisfaction of CIBC. An annual criminal record check may also be required.

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

item.title: Machine Learning Engineer, Data Enablement, Advanced Analytics & AI
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

Job Description

We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients. At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

What You’ll Be Doing

Embedded within the Advanced Analytics & AI (EAA) group, we are a blended team of full-stack Data Scientists and ML Engineers. Our mandate is to build and deploy machine learning models as data products and services. As an enterprise group we work with multiple partners and use-case types across our bank, including Marketing, Client Operations, Payments and many other business groups.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Data Science Expertise: You will use your expertise in Machine Learning to develop reproducible models, develop model evaluation, training and monitoring pipelines.

  • MLOps: You will utilize your strong Python programming skills to refactor experimental notebooks into production grade Python modules using functional programming. You will deploy batch models to production by utilizing tools such as Jenkins. You will create tables in our feature/model serving store as a means to store our batch model outputs via Python. You will assist with the maintenance and monitoring of models and data services in production.

  • Champion Best Practices: You will champion the team’s code-style, work-flow patterns and project structure standards You will lead by example by writing great documentation, practicing test-driven-development and properly annotating your code.

  • Trusted Partner: You will actively engage with other data scientists, engineers & business clientele to build trust and credibility. You will support your colleagues in areas by sharing ideas and brainstorming approaches to problems.

What We’re Looking For

  • Demonstrated knowledge of data science & machine learning with Python using common data science libraries, such as the PyData stack, and other ML frameworks

  • Strong Python programming skills including creating/debugging Python scripts in an non-notebook environment (e.g. PyCharm or VSCode) and writing modular code in a functional programming style.

  • Demonstrated knowledge writing SQL scripts to query relational databases and data warehouses

  • Familiarity with git, GitHub & conda

  • Familiarity with Linux systems & proficient at writing basic bash scripts

  • A conceptual understanding or exposure to Docker.

  • Any of these would be considered an asset :

    • Familiarity with the Flask or FastAPI web frameworks

    • Any exposure to DevOps tools, such as Jenkins and writing Jenkins pipelines is a big plus

    • Familiarity with scripting in SAS and SAS Enterprise Guide       

    • Familiarity working with git branching and merging

    • Familiarity with Microsoft Azure cloud platform

    • Familiarity with front-end frameworks, such as Bootstrap & Angular.

  • You have an a degree in: computer science, engineering, the natural sciences, math, other related quantitative field, or relevant work experience.

  • Minimum 1 year of relevant experience working either in industry, academia or co-op programs.

  • You have a strong sense of intellectual curiosity. You are intellectually curious and often think about ways to improve how we work. You may not know every tool or framework, but your innate sense of curiosity drives you to learn and grow your technical and business acumen. Along the same lines, you will have plenty of training opportunities and support from your peers and manager to fill in the gaps in your skill sets.

  • You embrace change and champion analytics. You empower and enable your team to make continuous improvement. You enjoy sharing knowledge and ideas with your colleagues & business partners, becoming an engaged member of the analytics community at our bank.

  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home.

  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity.

  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning and comprehensive product training.

  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan.

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified below and where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit.

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Toronto-CC North 26th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

item.title: Consultant, Risk Analytics
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

Reporting to the Senior Manager, Small Business Risk Management, you will be well versed in designing, building and implementing account acquisition and account management strategies with a focus on increasing auto-approval rates and decreasing loss rates. Expert level SAS, SQL coding skills are required to extract value from data combined with strong communication skills for presentation of risk-reward analysis to Senior Management. Reporting (standard and ad hoc) will require attention to detail and accuracy.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Data driven - Actively work with other business partners across the organization to ensure that work is aligned to our mandate and objectives.   Lead and support in-depth client insights studies using SAS, and create an analytical framework to help solve key business questions and test hypotheses. A strong understanding of reporting, analysis and data mining combined with  practical industry experience is required.
  • Continuous improvement mindset – Execute a strong focus on process improvement. Regularly identify, develop and implement operational process enhancements with the goal of improving efficiencies and synergies between internal and external partners.
  • Communication and relationship management - Lead and assist in preparing comprehensive presentations as needed to highlight key insights from deep dive analysis along with any recommendations that can be adopted to help address gaps or opportunities.  Manage a number of high priority requests to support management in order to support the bank’s strategy. Interact and work effectively across multiple internal teams, and establish a process to facilitate data/information sharing that ensures a consistent, common understanding of key client metrics.
  • Critical thinking - Apply critical thinking, creativity and sound judgement to identify issues and opportunities.  You can sort through complex and ambiguous scenarios to understand root causes and make tough but reasoned choices between competing alternatives and opinions.  You seek to understand before proposing solutions and although you intuitively know something doesn’t make sense, you rely on data and fact to inform decisions and recommendations rather than opinion. Openly and frequently share your knowledge, ideas and views because you know your perspective matters.
  • Project execution - Own and lead projects from inception to execution – such as, working with all stakeholders across the organization to develop a holistic client contribution framework & assessment to the automation of the entire process. Stay abreast of industry best practices regarding analytical methods and technologies.

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate experience with at least 3-5 years’ experience and strong skills in data extraction/manipulation and statistical analysis tools, including SAS (required), SQL; comfort with exploring how new and emerging data can be used; Knowledge of data visualization tools such as COGNOS, Tableau, etc. is an asset. Working in applied data & analytics problems in retail banking, including is an asset.  Experience creating Access/VBA based reporting databases is an strong asset.
  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.
  • You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
  • You love to learn. You\'re passionate about growing your knowledge, and you know that there is no limit to what you
  • You have a degree/diploma in a relevant bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or quantitative discipline such as Applied Statistics; related banking/business/finance knowledge is considered an asset
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Job Location

Toronto-CC East 10th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

item.title: Senior Manager, Analytics Strategy and Management
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

We’re on a mission to build the relationship-focused bank of the future and we’re looking for the passionate collaborators, innovators, advisors, and leaders who can get us there. Our distinct culture is built on a shared commitment to do what’s right for our clients, our people, and our communities, and we strive for excellence in everything we do. Because life at CIBC is not only what you do, but how you do it.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

What You’ll Be Doing

The Senior Manager, Analytics Strategy and Management will be accountable for leading strategic engagements and for managing the operations in Analytics & Decision Science.  This role will report to the VP, Analytics & Decision Science.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Strategic Thinking Approach – Think strategically, mobilize and engage teams from across the organization to drive, manage and execute on strategic PBB Analytics & Decision Science engagements.
  • Business Management & Effectiveness – Take ownership of Analytics & Decision Science business management functions.  Identify, recommend and implement changes that enhance operations whether through technology or other processes to ensure the efficiency and effectiveness of the department.  Lead integrated Analytics & Decision Science team engagements.
  • Relationship Management - Manage the relationship between Analytics & Decision Science and various partners throughout the bank with a high focus on client experience and partnering for shared success.  Build internal and external relationships as required to help ensure we are providing the right level of service to our leadership team and business partners. 
  • Communication -  Excellent verbal and writing skills to effectively articulate ideas and opinions that involve analysis, processes, and technology solutions to others with different disciplinary backgrounds. Ability to produce a variety of business documents that demonstrate command of language, clarity of thought and orderliness of presentation.
  • Reporting - Track progress and conduct analysis of data and reports. Support in the tracking and communication of performance metrics.

Who You Are  

  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. Understanding internal banking processes and how they translate into data outputs.
  • You act like an owner. You thrive when you\'re empowered to take the lead, go above and beyond, and deliver results.
  • You embrace and champion change. You\'ll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.
  • Your influence makes an impact. You use your relationships and technical knowledge to influence enterprise projects.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contactMailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work in Canada at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit
  • This is a regular full time role with a schedule of 37.5 hours each week.

item.title: Manager, Pension Analytics, Performance & Operations
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing    


Pension Investment Management (PIM), Treasury has overall responsibility to develop and operate a sustainable investment strategy for the bank’s defined benefit pension plans. The bank operates a complex and market leading pension investment management function in a bespoke manner to meet its unique objectives as the only top-5 tier bank to continue to offer its employees an open defined benefit pension plan. The PIM group is led by the Chief Investment Officer and comprises a team of four investment professionals who manage over $8BN in assets across both public and private markets. The Manager, Pension Analytics, Performance & Operations is responsible for the delivery of insightful quantitative analysis and modelling that supports top-down pension management recommendations, asset allocation decisions, portfolio construction optimization and development of bespoke asset class strategies. In addition, timely reporting to support investment monitoring and oversight activities, as well as frontline risk management of funded status, balance sheet impact, hedging programs and liquidity capacity .
 

How You’ll Succeed


Reporting & Analysis - Managing the end-to-end quarterly investment reporting process including the production of investment returns, their validation with managers, attribution analysis, identification of key performance drivers, portfolio positioning review, aggregation of risk positions across investments, and generation of final reports.

Analytics and Modelling- Identifying meaningful analytics from which tangible management actions can be taken in relationto performance and risk management as well as Developing and maintaining models of pension assets and liabilities.

Managing Systems & Process- Independently running the monthly pension reporting process including estimates of funded status, balance sheet impact, attribution of changes, and key risk sensitivities., managing the private markets monitoring system in near real time and developing subject matter expertise on the system, managing updates to investment policy, pension governance documents and the business unit’s process documentation, managing the month-end asset valuation process with pension accounting and investment managers with the direction and review of senior team members. General operational management of the investment program including investment administration, cash management and ensuring control processes are upheld at all times.

Who You Are

o    Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.
o    You love to learn. You\'re passionate about growing your knowledge, and you know that there is no limit to what you can achieve.
o    You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
o    You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information using strong financial modelling, analytical and valuation skills. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.

o    You have demonstrated experience working on and supporting the delivery of pension investment strategy through a combination of actuarial, risk management, quantitative modelling, asset liability management, performance/attribution reporting and governance roles (5-7 years). You have knowledge of institutional investment assets and cash management at an operational level. In addition, you have a degree in actuarial science, risk management, quantitative discipline, economics, finance or a related subject as a prerequisite. It\'s an asset if you have a CFA, FRM and/or actuarial designation(s).

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Job Location

Toronto-161 Bay St 11th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

item.title: Sr. Consultant, Frontline & Distribution Analytics
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing     

This Senior Consultant role is the ideal position for an advanced data analyst who is excited about using data analytics to drive business insights leading to evidence-based decision making at all levels for the Personal and Business Banking lines of business, including the Mobile Advice channel. The incumbent will support the on-going execution of ad-hoc requests using key data sources to provide and create quantifiable value by the use of data, analytics and insights. This includes developing Executive level presentations that drive actionable insights using data, and measurements of effectiveness of all business sales strategies and campaigns. The incumbent will have the responsibility for understanding the usage of key data sources in order to execute on ongoing ad-hoc requests.    

The incumbent will draw upon a wide variety of client, product, sales, and channel data, and have a leadership role in providing recommendation to the Leadership team and enable Management to make well informed decision by providing data, analytics, and regular reports.

The Senior Consultant will need to demonstrate advanced analytical, financial modelling and critical thinking skills, apply financial, product and project management disciplines, and have a clear understanding of the market, the competitive environment and the firm’s strategic priorities to provide value to the team.

    

How You’ll Succeed

  • Presentation: You have the ability to prepare analytical based presentations that present complex data information in an understandable and actionable way.
  • Ad Hoc Analyses – Develop ad hoc analyses to address key business issues as they arise.   Complete complex client and product analyses utilizing a variety of structured and unstructured data sources.  Develop and share insights based this analysis with a wide variety of audience  
  • Reporting – Develop and maintain ongoing reporting related to key sales force, client, product and channel trends
  • Strategic Thinker  - You have experience in providing insights to inform decisions, forecasting and planning. Drive, manage and execute analytics initiatives as well as providing recommendations and best practices for new integrations
  • Strong Partner – You will develop change management strategies and maintain open, collaborative lines of communication to ensure awareness of requirements and impacts. You will gather critical information on the various management techniques/client issues/concerns, strategic priorities, business challenges and specific project requirements to support the development of a winning value proposition
  • Business Intelligence  Play an integral role in contributing to the development of business intelligence, an integrated view/plan for data & analytics, measurements, and controls that will be used in reporting identified metrics at multiple levels within CIBC. Help define business and process requirements and manage deliverables against business partner expectations and time sensitive deadlines

Who You Are

  • Technical Skills. You demonstrate data/financial modeling and analytical experience. You have advanced proficiency in Excel and Alteryx. SAS, Python/R, Tableau and Oracle experience is an asset. You have the ability to perform complex data integration and transformation
  • Analytical. You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
  • Detail Oriented. You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making
  • Goal Oriented. You are driven to succeed. You are motivated by accomplishing your goals and delivering your best to make an impact
  • Client-Focused. You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability
  • Education - University degree in business, commerce, mathematics, computer science or computer/software engineering is preferred. MBA/CFA is an asset

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Job Location

Toronto-CC East 5th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

item.title: Senior Manager, Fraud Analytics
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

In this role, you will be leading and supervising the work of a group of analysts with a focus on fraud mitigation, computer programming, statistical models, and reporting associated with the development and implementation of strategies. You will assist the team in the development and application of complex analysis, cost/benefits analysis, optimization, predictive models and sampling. You will also be responsible for maintaining tight control over impact to legitimate customers from fraud management strategies and regular reporting of statistics to SVP and EVP levels of results in this area.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Analytical Thinking – Improve fraud monitoring by responding to fraud trends and mitigate risk surrounding operational processes. Conduct feasibility studies and cost/benefit analysis to clearly depict possible fraud mitigation rule options and recommended courses of action.
  • Communication Skills –  Utilize excellent verbal and writing skills to effectively articulate ideas and opinions that involve analysis, interpretation, and assessment.
  • Leadership Skills - Provide leadership and effective management of business unit staff to influence employee commitment to the organization

Who You Are

  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.
  • You can demonstrate experience using SAS, Tableau and/or SQL. You are current in analytical techniques and constantly seek to improve your knowledge in this field. You are curious and proactive, you constantly offer new solutions based on sound analysis.
  • You have a degree/diploma in preferably Mathematics, Statistics, Business or Computer Science Based discipline.
  • You love to learn. You\'re passionate about growing your knowledge, and you know that there is no limit to what you can achieve.
  • You look beyond the moment. You make decisions and take actions that will make a difference today and tomorrow. You proactively seek new opportunities to define what\'s possible.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

item.title: Consultant, Strategy
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

How You’ll Succeed

  • Strategic Problem Solving – Frame complex problem to be addressed, identify and execute required analysis with Analytics partners, and synthesize key findings to help the teams reach decisions
  • Analytics & Insights – Leverage internal CIBC data, external data and insights to develop a story and drive the need for change. Quantify impacts to the client and employee experience. Support pilots and bring meaning to data and results.  Build, develop and sustain data models & algorithms that support key strategic recommendations and decisions related to frontline distribution.  Lead work packages to enhance or implement new operating models, procedures and standards by researching/analyzing relevant data, and developing proposals and recommendations
  • Consulting – Foster collaborative relationships with internal stakeholders and peers. Provide value-added advisory support on strategic direction and best practices.  Participate and support in in-flight projects to ensure that the strategic vision and its benefits are realized.  Stay connected with the client journey and engage with our frontline partners regularly to understand the current strengths and challenges

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate knowledge of strategic planning principles sufficient to identify and develop initiatives. You have a strong understanding of Personal & Business Banking and enhanced technical knowledge in order to deal with more complex problems independently. You have superb analytical and financial acumen with developed knowledge in several areas of Financial Services sufficient to interpret, analyze and apply relevant issues and developments.
  • You are a problem solver.  You have creative problem solving skills sufficient to resolve or identify innovative alternatives or opportunities where established procedures for problems sometimes do not exist.
  • You deliver with urgency. You have the ability to manage multiple concurrent objectives, projects, groups or activities.  Effective judgment in prioritizing and time allocation
  • You have strong technical skills. You can demonstrate financial modeling skills in working with large datasets and ability to synthesize complex problems and solutions to “easy to understand” concepts.
  • Education. Background in Finance, Business, Computer Engineering/Science based discipline. Relevant graduate degree (MBA) or management consultant experience is an asset. 
  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You have well-developed presentation skills, highly-developed writing skills, and influential skills sufficient to accomplish "significant" promotion & negotiation on CIBC’s behalf and to convince others of the value of preferred options or alternatives in situations where distinct differences of opinion or approach exist.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit
